definitions.definition: A conventional gilt-edged security, a kind of bond paying the holder a fixed cash payment (or coupon ) every six months until maturity , at which point the holder receives the final payment and the return of the principal .

main_definition: ( finance ) A conventional gilt-edged security, a kind of bond paying the holder a fixed cash payment (or coupon ) every six months until maturity , at which point the holder receives the final payment and the return of the principal .
